children.name: num_cols
children.label: How many columns do you want?

children.name: two_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: The grid is based on 12 columns.  The numbers in each choice represent the ratio of the grid that column will take up.  Give it a try. You'll see what I mean.

children.name: three_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: The grid is based on 12 columns.  The numbers in each choice represents the ratio of the grid that column will take up.  Give it a try. You'll see what I mean.

children.name: four_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: The grid is based on 12 columns.  The numbers in each choice represents the ratio of the grid that column will take up.  Give it a try. You'll see what I mean.

children.name: mobile_stacking
children.label: Use Mobile Stacking Options
children.help_text: Please be mindful when using this feature along with other advanced-level features such as the COLUMN PULL UP feature. You'll want to ensure they play nicely with the settings you choose.
children.inline_help_text: ADVANCED FEATURE: Turning this will allow you to set the stacking order on mobile. Hover over the tooltip for more info.

children.name: stack_order_2_col
children.label: Edit Mobile Stacking Order
children.inline_help_text: IMPORTANT: Each column must have a different position (ie. You can't have two columns set to "first" or things will get super wonky).

children.name: stack_order_3_col
children.label: Edit Mobile Stacking Order
children.inline_help_text: IMPORTANT: Each column must have a different position (ie. You can't have two columns set to "first" or things will get super wonky).

children.name: stack_order_4_col
children.label: Edit Mobile Stacking Order
children.inline_help_text: IMPORTANT: Each column must have a different position (ie. You can't have two columns set to "first" or things will get super wonky).

children.name: content
children.label: Rich Text Editor:
children.help_text: IMPORTANT: Do your very best not to give the text any specific style like color or font size through this editor. Things like font-sizes will override other global styles and create visual inconsistencies.  Basically, it could look a bit wonky.
children.default:
You are Awesome. Don't forget it.

Distillery cornhole post-ironic shaman godard normcore tumblr put a bird on it. Austin bitters vice pitchfork, jean shorts craft beer kickstarter sriracha tilde pop-up fanny pack. Kale chips cold-pressed put a bird on it mumblecore kogi brooklyn farm-to-table blue bottle yuccie authentic kombucha migas. Literally tilde tacos paleo.

children.name: add_lottie_file
children.label: Add Lottie File (Animation)
children.help_text: Lottie files are super sweet animated files that you can find here: https://lottiefiles.com

children.name: lottie_embed
children.label: Paste Lottie Player Embed Code
children.help_text: When pasting the code DO NOT include the line that starts with "script".  IMPORTANT: To ensure the animated image is responsive on all screen sizes, set the width to 100% and remove the height property (style="width=100%")   See commodore documentation for directions.

children.name: lottie_above
children.label: Place Lottie Above Content
children.help_text: By default the Lottie animation will site below content.

children.name: submit_alt
children.label: Use Submit Button Alternative Style:
children.help_text: This is the alternative style that you can set from your Theme Settings.

children.name: btn_inline
children.label: Put button on same line as the input field:
children.help_text: IMPORTANT:  Only use this when you have a single input field in the form.  If there are multiple, chances are it's going to look really wonky.

children.name: btn_label
children.label: Button Label:
children.help_text: This is where you can add the button text.

children.name: pop_up_content
children.label: Pop-up Content:
children.default:
Add a headline.

Lorem ipsum dolor amet food truck affogato cronut freegan skateboard photo booth, tousled pickled 90's wayfarers retro succulents hoodie edison bulb ramps. XOXO seitan tote bag, offal vape air plant disrupt chia plaid taxidermy cloud bread microdosing 8-bit.

default.pop_up_content:
Add a headline.

Lorem ipsum dolor amet food truck affogato cronut freegan skateboard photo booth, tousled pickled 90's wayfarers retro succulents hoodie edison bulb ramps. XOXO seitan tote bag, offal vape air plant disrupt chia plaid taxidermy cloud bread microdosing 8-bit.

children.name: bg_image
children.label: Background Image
children.help_text: When using background images, a portion will always get cropped out depending upon the size and ratio of both the image and column.  If it's important the entire image displayed, INSERT the image using the rich text editor above instead.
children.inline_help_text: This will set the background image for the entire column.

children.name: img_pos
children.label: Image Position:
children.help_text:
This will allow you to select which portion of the image you'd like to show.  

Since this is a "background image" that needs to be responsive to a variety of screen sizes, there will ways be a portion of the photo cropped out.

children.name: overlay_color
children.label: Overlay Color
children.inline_help_text: Will only display when you select an image background.

children.name: gd_overlay_color_1
children.label: Gradient Overlay Color 1:
children.inline_help_text: Will only display when you select an image background.

children.name: gd_overlay_color_2
children.label: Gradient Overlay Color 2:
children.inline_help_text: Will only display when you select an image background.

children.name: add_space
children.label: Space Around Content:
children.help_text: Turning this on will let you set the padding around the content in this column.
children.inline_help_text: Add some space above, below, or on the sides of the content.

children.name: add_margin
children.label: Add Margin Around Column
children.inline_help_text: Adds a 10px margin on the left and right sides of the column.

children.name: desktop_spacing
children.label: Desktop Spacing:
children.inline_help_text: This set the spacing for... you guessed it! Desktops.

children.name: tablet_spacing
children.label: Tablet Spacing:
children.inline_help_text: This set the spacing for tablet devices in portrait mode.

children.name: mobile_spacing
children.label: Mobile Spacing:
children.inline_help_text: This set the spacing for mobile phones.

children.name: pull_col_up
children.label: Pull Column Up:
children.inline_help_text: Slide the column and content over the row above.

children.name: desktop
children.label: Pull up on Desktop
children.inline_help_text: This is set in pixels.

children.name: tablet
children.label: Pull up on Tablet
children.help_text: This gives you the option to set a different number on tablets as the columns may stack.
children.inline_help_text: This is set in pixels.

children.name: mobile
children.label: Pull up on Mobile
children.help_text: This gives you the option to set a different number on mobile as the columns may stack.
children.inline_help_text: This is set in pixels.

children.name: custom_divider_color
children.label: Custom Divider Color:
children.help_text: Flip this on if you'd like to use a different color divider than you've set as the global default.

children.name: custom_text_color
children.label: Custom Text Color:
children.help_text: Turning this on will enable you to set the color of text and links if you need them to be different than the default settings.

children.name: form_max_width
children.label: Form Width inside the Column (%):
children.help_text: This setting is going to control the max width of the form

children.name: btn_align
children.label: Form Button Alignment:
children.help_text: If you have the toggle on above to put the button inline with the form, this option won't have any effect.

children.name: vert_align_center
children.label: Vertical Align Content to the Center:
children.help_text: This feature is awesome when the column to the right or left is much longer and you want this one to be centered vertically in this column.
children.inline_help_text: Align this column's content so it's centered with the column next to it.

default.content:
You are Awesome. Don't forget it.

children.label: Vertical Align Content to the Center:
children.help_text: This feature is awesome when the column to the right or left is much longer and you want this one to be centered vertically in this column.
children.inline_help_text: Align this column's content so it's centered with the column next to it.

default.content:
You are Awesome. Don't forget it.

Distillery cornhole post-ironic shaman godard normcore tumblr put a bird on it. Austin bitters vice pitchfork, jean shorts craft beer kickstarter sriracha tilde pop-up fanny pack. Kale chips cold-pressed put a bird on it mumblecore kogi brooklyn farm-to-table blue bottle yuccie authentic kombucha migas. Literally tilde tacos paleo.

Add a headline.

Lorem ipsum dolor amet food truck affogato cronut freegan skateboard photo booth, tousled pickled 90's wayfarers retro succulents hoodie edison bulb ramps. XOXO seitan tote bag, offal vape air plant disrupt chia plaid taxidermy cloud bread microdosing 8-bit.

children.name: test
children.label: Test:
children.inline_help_text: This is currently a test. Please disregard.

children.name: bg_image
children.label: Upload Your Background Image:
children.help_text: The recommended size is 1920 x 1280px

children.name: image_loading
children.label: Image Loading:
children.inline_help_text: Lazy image loading can improve performance if this module is lower on the page.

children.name: video_clip
children.label: ██████ Upload Video Clip(s)
children.help_text: With this video player you can add multiple smaller video clips that will get stitched together. This will help the page load much faster.  PRO-TIP:  Go to www.youcompress.com and compress your MP4 files so they are even faster to load.  Generally, you want between a 2 -3MB file size.

children.name: mp4
children.label: Video (mp4):
children.help_text: When uploading a video you want to keep the file size as small as possible so that it loads quickly.  Generally, you're going to want to keep it under 20MB.

children.name: video_bg_image
children.label: Video Background Image:
children.help_text: Set the background image to the first frame in the starting video to help reduce the flash when the video loops.

children.name: parallax
children.label: Parallax Scrolling:
children.help_text:
If you turn this on, be sure that you have uploaded a background image with a large enough height so that there is room for the image to do its scrolling magic. 

1920 x 1280px will work great in most cases but it depends on the height of this content row. 

IMPORTANT: If you are not using a background image, it's BEST to keep this off.

children.name: parallax_on_mobile
children.label: Parallax On Mobile
children.help_text: Enables Parallax On Mobile

children.name: bg_size
children.label: Background Size:
children.help_text:
Cover: Resize the background image to cover the entire container, even if it has to stretch the image or cut a little bit off one of the edges

Contain: Resize the background image to make sure the image is fully visible.

Initial: Sets this property to its default value.

children.name: img_pos
children.label: Image Position:
children.help_text:
This will allow you to select which portion of the image you'd like to show.  

Since this is a "background image" that needs to be responsive to a variety of screen sizes, there will ways be a portion of the photo cropped out.

children.name: full_bleed
children.label: Full Bleed:
children.inline_help_text: Remove the extra space on right and left sides of the row.

children.name: remove_col_space
children.label: Remove Space Between Columns
children.inline_help_text: Removes white space between columns so they sit flush next to one another.

children.name: shadow
children.label: Do you want to add a subtle shadow?
children.help_text: This will add a subtle inner or outer shadow on the entire row.

children.name: overlay_bg
children.label: Do you want to add an overlay?

children.name: add_wave_top
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Top)
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the top of the row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row below has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row above.

children.name: add_wave_btm
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Bottom)
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the base of row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row below has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row below.

children.name: pull_up
children.label: Pull Up Row:
children.help_text: This will give you the option to pull the content container up over the row above. This can be an awesome visual technique when used subtly.  IMPORTANT: Set the row's background color (above) to have 0% .

children.name: pull_up_num_desktop
children.label: Pull Up Content (Desktop):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by.

children.name: pull_up_num_tablet
children.label: Pull Up Content (Tablet):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by.

children.name: pull_up_num_mobile
children.label: Pull Up Content (Mobile):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by on mobile devices.

children.name: con_padding
children.label: Container Padding (Desktop):
children.help_text: It's a good idea to give the content a little breathing room. This is where you can set the padding.

children.name: con_padding_tablet
children.label: Container Padding (Tablet):
children.help_text: It's a good idea to give the content a little breathing room. This is where you can set the padding.

children.name: con_padding_mobile
children.label: Container Padding (mobile):
children.help_text: It's a good idea to give the content a little breathing room. This is where you can set the padding.

children.name: subtle_shadow
children.label: Add Subtle Shadow:
children.help_text: This will add a slight glow around the content container to lift it of the page ever so elegantly.

children.name: no_padding_btm
children.label: Remove Padding Bottom:
children.help_text: This will remove the extra padding on the bottom. This is especially helpful when you don't have the subtle shadow turned on.

children.name: pointer_event
children.label: Allow Elements Under to be Clicked:
children.help_text: Toggle this option on when you're trying to float an image with a transparent background over the row above that has a CTA or links that need to be interacted with.

children.name: section_id
children.label: CSS ID:
children.help_text: This will place and ID on the row that you'll be able to set an anchor tag and have the user jump down to this section of the page.

children.name: section_class
children.label: CSS Class:
children.help_text: This is helpful if you know just a enough of CSS to be dangerous.  Make sure that class names don't have spaces.
